	As of June 6, 2016, there were 53,316,134 shares of our common stock outstanding, with
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	85
</FONT>
	shareholders of record.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #FF6600">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	The number of record shareholders was determined from the records of our stock transfer agent and does not include beneficial owners of common stock whose shares are held in the names of various security brokers, dealers, registered clearing houses or agencies, banks or other fiduciaries.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Dividends
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We have not declared a cash dividend on any class of common equity in the last two fiscal years.&#160; There are no restrictions on our ability to pay cash dividends, other than any state law that may be applicable.&#160; Under Nevada law, dividends may be paid to the extent that a corporation's assets exceed its liabilities and it is able to pay its debts as they become due in the usual course of business.&#160; Our Board does not anticipate paying any dividends in the foreseeable future; it intends to retain the earnings that could be distributed, if any, for operations.
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000">
	Item 7.
</FONT>
<FONT ID="TRGRRTFTOHTMLTAB" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 5.14PT">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; COLOR: #000000">
	Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<A NAME="PROFIRE_HTM_ID_0_41">
<!--ANCHOR-->
</A>
	For a complete understanding, this Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations should be read in conjunction with the Consolidated Financial Statements and Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements contained in this annual report on Form 10-K.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Some of the statements set forth in this section are forward-looking statements relating to our future results of operations.&#160; Our actual results may vary from the results anticipated by these statements.&#160; Please see "
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Information Concerning Forward-Looking Statements
</FONT>
	" on page 4.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT">
</DIV>
<EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT">
	Results of Operations
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT">
<U>
	Comparison of the years ended March 31, 2016 and 2015.
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<U>
	Total Revenues
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Total revenues for the year ended March 31, 2016,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	decreased 47%
</FONT>
	to $27,072,446 from $51,179,392 in the year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; For the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, product sales accounted for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	89%
</FONT>
	of total revenues and service sales accounted for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	11%
</FONT>
	of total revenue, while for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, product sales accounted for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	93%
</FONT>
	of total revenues and service sales accounted for
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	7%
</FONT>
	of total revenue.&#160; We recognize that with current industry conditions, the historical growth rates we achieved prior to the industry downturn will not be attainable in the coming year due to the lack of purchasing by exploration and production companies in the oil and gas industry.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We will continue to focus on developing new products, diversifying into new markets and industries, and enhancing our marketing and sales efforts with key customers and prospects. We anticipate that as we do so, sales can stabilize in the short-term and we will be able to increase revenues and revenue stability over the long-term. We expect that product sales will continue to account for the significant majority of our revenue.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	30
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	22%
</FONT>
	of total revenues were generated from products and services sold in Canada.&#160; The remaining
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	78%
</FONT>
	of total revenue was generated from sales in the United States. By comparison, during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	29%
</FONT>
	of our total revenues were generated from Canada and the remaining
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	71%
</FONT>
	was generated from the United States.&#160; We plan to continue making selective strategic investments for future revenue growth as we find opportunities with meaningful returns even in the midst of the challenging industry environment.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<U>
	Cost of Goods Sold
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Cost of goods sold during the year ended March 31, 2016, was $11,027,114 for product sales and $2,405,012
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	for
</FONT>
	services, for a total cost of goods sold of $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	13,432,126
</FONT>
	. This is compared to $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	21,240,363
</FONT>
	for product sales and $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	2,716,272
</FONT>
	for services, for a total cost of goods sold of $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	23,956,635
</FONT>
	during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015. While total revenue
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	decreased
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	47%
</FONT>
	, total cost of goods sold
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	decreased
</FONT>
	by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	44%
</FONT>
	; consequently, our gross profit for our fiscal 2016 was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	50%
</FONT>
	of total revenues, compared to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	53%
</FONT>
	during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015. The increase in total cost of goods sold as a percentage of total revenues was primarily attributable to a de-leveraging effect derived from overhead costs being more difficult to absorb at lower revenue levels.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Given the current and expected industry conditions in the oil and gas industry, we have been and will continue to work with our suppliers to control our inventory costs, which has the largest impact on margin. We have been relatively successful in maintaining our pricing during the industry volatility, though customers have sought price reductions. We anticipate holding prices relatively stable, within the confines of normal sales operations. Additionally, if sales of services increase as a percentage of total revenue, cost of goods sold, as a percentage of total revenue, may increase. We anticipate this could result in slightly lower than historical gross margin.&#160; Cost of goods sold will continue to fluctuate as a function of our product mix, as our proprietary products tend to have significantly higher margins than our resold products.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<U>
	General and Administrative Expenses
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	General and administrative expenses for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, were $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	12,264,442
</FONT>
	or a
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	25%
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	decrease
</FONT>
	compared to the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; As a percentage of operating expenses, general and administrative expenses were
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	90%
</FONT>
	in the fiscal year ended fiscal March 31, 2016 compared to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	87%
</FONT>
	in fiscal March 31, 2015. Given the current industry condition, we have implemented various cost-reduction initiatives throughout the Company including a reduction in headcount from 140 to 93 employees and a reduction in professional fees by more than $500,000 compared to the prior year. We continue to evaluate expenses to determine what additional expense-reduction actions, if any, should be taken.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<U>
	Research and Development
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Research and development expense
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	decreased
</FONT>
	to $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	899,013
</FONT>
	from $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	1,832,671
</FONT>
	representing
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	7%
</FONT>
	and
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	10%
</FONT>
	of total operating expenses for the years ended March 31, 2016, and March 31, 2015, respectively. Despite the down turn in the industry over the past year we have refined and focused our efforts on projects with significant return on investment in the short- and long-term, and will continue to focus on providing innovative and valuable products and services to our customers. We are focused on developing and completing modules of our PF3100 platform that will allow us to enter new markets and hopefully, new industries, as well as other important projects. We feel that these investments in product development will help improve strategic position and capture the greatest value for all of our stakeholders.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	31
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 13.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<U>
	Depreciation Expense
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Depreciation expense, not related to cost of sales, during fiscal year ending March 31, 2016, was
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
	$
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	516,786
</FONT>
	or
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	7%
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	lower
</FONT>
	than the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, of $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	558,231
</FONT>
	due to improved accuracy in depreciation allocations to appropriate departments and to costs of goods sold as well as a change in estimated useful lives of certain asset types. As a percentage of operating expenses, depreciation
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	increased
</FONT>
	from approximately
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	3.0%
</FONT>
	of operating expenses in the year ended March 31, 2015 to
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	3.8%
</FONT>
	of operating expenses in the year ended March 31, 2016, due primarily to a decline in revenues. We expect that depreciation expense will remain relatively constant in the coming year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<U>
	Total Other Income (Expense)
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, total other income
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	increased
</FONT>
	by
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	262%
</FONT>
	to income of $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	202,493
</FONT>
	from income of $55,889, in the year ended March 31, 2015. The increase in other income was attributable to the effect of exchange rates on intercompany transactions as well as interest generation from higher cash balances during the fiscal year. We anticipate realizing a yet-higher amount of interest income in fiscal year 2017 as we work to improve our treasury management by allocating cash to higher interest-generating investments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 39.6PT">
<U>
	Net Income Before Income Tax
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Net income before income taxes during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016,
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	decreased
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	98%
</FONT>
	to $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	162,572
</FONT>
	from $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	8,591,588
</FONT>
	during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015. The decreases realized in total revenues, total cost of goods sold and total operating expenses combined to decrease net income before income taxes significantly. The decline in oil prices &#8211; and oilfield equipment purchasing &#8211; has negatively impacted our revenue and thus decreased our operating leverage and income before taxes. The current industry conditions have elongated the time frame in which we anticipate to see returns from prior investments; however, as we invest strategically, we still expect to realize more significant returns in the coming quarters and years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 13.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<U>
	Income Tax Expense
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 13.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Income tax expense
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	decreased
</FONT>
	&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	96%
</FONT>
	from $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	2,843,905
</FONT>
	during the year ended March 31, 2015, to $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	127,828
</FONT>
	during the year ended March 31, 2016. This decrease in income tax expense was a result of the decrease in net income before income taxes.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 13.4PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<U>
	Foreign Currency Translation Gain (Loss)
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 13.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 39.6PT">
	Our consolidated financial statements are presented in U.S. dollars.&#160; Our functional currencies are the U.S. dollar (USD) and the Canadian dollar, and our reporting currency is the USD.&#160; Our financial statements were translated to U.S. dollars using year-end exchange rates for the balance sheet and weighted average exchange rates for the statements of operations.&#160; Equity transactions were translated using historical rates.&#160; Foreign currency translation gains or losses as a result of fluctuations in the exchange rates are reflected in the statement of operations and comprehensive income.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 39.6PT">
	Therefore, the translation adjustment in our consolidated financial statements represents the translation differences from translation of our financial statements.&#160; As a result, the translation adjustment is commonly, but not always, positive if the average exchange rates are lower than exchange rates on the date of the financial statements and negative if the average exchange rates are higher than exchange rates on the date of the financial statements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	32
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage33"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	During the year ended March 31, 2016, we recognized a foreign currency translation
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	loss
</FONT>
	of $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	393,701
</FONT>
	compared to foreign currency translation
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	loss
</FONT>
	of $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	1,657,930
</FONT>
	during the year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; This loss was the result of a weakening of the Canadian dollar relative to the US dollar in the reporting period.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<U>
	Total Comprehensive Income (Loss)
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	For the foregoing reasons, we realized total comprehensive loss of $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	358,957
</FONT>
	during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, compared to total comprehensive income of $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	4,089,753
</FONT>
	during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, a
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	decrease
</FONT>
	of
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	109%
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">

</DIV>

<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	On June 2, 2014, we filed a registration statement on Form S-1 to register shares of our common stock with the Securities and Exchange Commission to be offered to the public by us and by certain selling stockholders named in the registration statement. We also filed amendments to such registration statement on June 19, 2014, June 24, 2014, June 25, 2014, and June 26, 2014. Our net proceeds from the sale of shares of our common stock by us pursuant to the registration statement was approximately $16,430,000, after deducting underwriting discounts and commissions and estimated offering expenses payable by us. We did not receive any proceeds from the sale of shares of our common stock by the selling stockholders. We have used and plan to continue using the proceeds from the offering to help fund Company growth initiatives.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	37,055,497
</FONT>
	and total assets of $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	47,267,840
</FONT>
	including cash and cash equivalents of $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	21,292,595
</FONT>
	.&#160; At this same period, we had total current liabilities of $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	1,849,980
</FONT>
	and total liabilities of $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	2,482,712
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH; LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	At March 31, 2016, net cash provided by operating activities during fiscal 2016 was
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	$7,332,933
</FONT>
	with working capital of $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	35,202,517
</FONT>
	and no current capital commitments outside of normal operations.&#160; We have no long-term debt.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 14.75PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	As of March 31, 2016, we had cash of $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	21,292,595
</FONT>
	compared to $
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	14,144,796
</FONT>
	as of March 31, 2015.&#160; We believe that our cash reserves are sufficient to meet our operating needs for the next twelve months.
</DIV>

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage34"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Summary of Material Contractual Commitments
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	None.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.3PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Inflation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We believe that inflation has not had a significant impact on our operations since inception.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Seasonality
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The purchasing decisions of our customers will sometimes be affected by weather and season.&#160; However, as we have expanded our U.S. operations we have realized a reduced seasonality in revenues as our sales are derived from an increasing number of locations and climates. While we expect some degree of seasonality for the foreseeable future due to operations in seasonal environments, we expect it to play a diminishing role in our future sales.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	As of March 31, 2016 and 2015, we had no off-balance sheet arrangements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.95PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Recently Issued Financial Accounting Standards
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We have evaluated recent accounting pronouncements and their adoption has not had or is not expected to have a material impact on our financial position, results of operations or cash flows.
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	As of the end of the period covered by this annual report on Form 10-K, management performed, with the participation of our Chief Executive Officer and our Chief Financial Officer, an evaluation of the effectiveness of our disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e) of the Exchange Act). Based on this evaluation, our principal executive officer and our principal financial officer concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures were ineffective as of such date.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	34
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	During the 2015 fiscal year, our stock prices reached levels that required us to begin reporting relative to Section 404 requirements of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act ("404 requirements"), as well as accelerate the schedule of our filings with the SEC.&#160; During the 2016 fiscal year our stock prices fell below the threshold for the additional 404 requirements.&#160; As such, our independent registered public accounting firm was not required to, and thus did not audit our internal control structure for the 2016 fiscal year; however, the audit was completed for our 2015 fiscal year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	Notwithstanding this finding of ineffective internal controls, we concluded that the consolidated financial statements included in this Form 10-K present fairly, in all material respects, our financial position, results of operations and cash flows for the periods presented in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States. This conclusion was also confirmed by our independent auditors.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<U>
	Management's Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	Our management is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting (as defined in Rule 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f) promulgated under the Exchange Act.) Internal control over financial reporting is a process designed by, or under the supervision of, the company's principal executive officer and principal financial officer to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of consolidated financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles and includes those policies and procedures that:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<TABLE ID="85F783229F1D4BB89C25F227E3D48EAA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11.16%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 88.84%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the entity;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11.16%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 88.84%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11.16%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 88.84%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles and that receipts and expenditures of the entity are being made in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the entity; and
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11.16%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 88.84%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11.16%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 88.84%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use or disposition of the entity's assets that could have a material effect on its consolidated financial statements.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements. Projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	Under the supervision and with the participation of our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, the Company's management conducted an assessment of the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting based on the criteria set forth in the Internal Control &#8212; Integrated Framework issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations (COSO) of the Treadway Commission (2013).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	Based upon this assessment, the Company's management concluded that our internal control over financial reporting entailed material weakness and was ineffective as of March 31, 2016. A material weakness is a deficiency, or combination thereof, in internal control over financial reporting, such that there is a reasonable possibility that a material misstatement of the Company's annual or interim financial statements will not be prevented or detected on a timely basis.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	35
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	We did not maintain effective controls over our day-to-day transaction processing, including non-routine transactions (see items below) and period-end financial reporting processes. Specifically, we identified material weakness related to:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#8226; revenue recognition (e.g., consistent requirements for documentation in every office where accounting functions are performed).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#8226; sufficient documentation of review- and analytical-processes (e.g., significant judgements and estimates, goodwill, amortization).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#8226; structuring of duties, controls, and permissions within financial systems (e.g., warehouse managers have the ability to create sales orders).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#8226; asset management and maintenance functions (e.g., documented and regular physical confirmation of asset existence).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#8226; segregation of duties (e.g., smaller office employees have the ability in the enterprise resource planning system to make transactions throughout the entirety of an accounting cycle).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#8226; cash disbursements (e.g., sufficiently documented approval for disbursements).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	Specific remediation initiatives are delineated hereafter in Management's Remediation Initiatives.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	As a management team, we continue to emphasize the value and import of a strong controls environment. We believe that such an emphasis, together with continued oversight of our processes and systems, will help create an increasingly strong, compliant, and thorough system of controls, which we expect will play an increasingly important role in our long-term growth.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<U>
	Changes in Internal Control over Financial Reporting
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	During the 2016 fiscal year, we hired a new Chief Financial Officer, and put in place enhanced processes and controls over inventory, sales, and other key areas.&#160; We also hired a payroll management company that provides enhanced reporting and visibility to the payroll process along with the implementation of a new ERP system.&#160; We believe the addition of a new Chief Financial Officer, implementation of a new payroll management company and ERP system will enhance our internal control framework.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<U>
	Management's Remediation Initiatives
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	Management has been actively developing a remediation plan and been implementing new controls and processes to address the aforementioned deficiencies. Upon receiving the results of our internal controls review, we have taken actions to strengthen our internal control structure, including the following:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<TABLE ID="69945E1161CF479185C5A485B7F053F2" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11.29%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 88.71%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Hired third parties to provide advice on COSO framework and risk control matrices;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11.29%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 88.71%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Implemented company-wide trainings over internal controls in relation with new accounting standard operating procedures including the requirement of supplying supporting evidence, proving the level of precision with which a control is performed, etc.;
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11.29%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 88.71%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Required evidence of review in nearly all controls; and
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11.29%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#183;
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 88.71%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Reviewed and updated each employee's access within the enterprise resource management system.
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	Management continues to meet with key managers and control owners to evaluate the effectiveness of internal controls and to ensure implementation of remediation initiatives.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">

</DIV>
<EFX_ACCOUNTANT_FEES>
<A NAME="FIS_ACCOUNTANT_FEES"></A>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Item 14.

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION_2"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<U>
	REPORT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	To the Board of Directors and Stockholders of
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	Profire Energy, Inc.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance sheets of Profire Energy, Inc. as of March 31, 2016 and 2015, and the related consolidated statements of income and other comprehensive income (loss), stockholders' equity, and cash flows for each of the years in the two-year period ended March 31, 2016. These consolidated financial statements are the responsibility of the Company's management. Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these consolidated financial statements based on our audits.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States). Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the consolidated financial statements are free of material misstatement. The company is not required to have, nor were we engaged to perform, an audit of its internal control over financial reporting as of March 31, 2016. Our audit of the 2016 consolidated financial statements included consideration of internal control over financial reporting as a basis for designing audit procedures that are appropriate in the circumstances, but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the company's internal control over financial reporting. Accordingly, we express no such opinion as of March 31, 2016. An audit also includes examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the consolidated financial statements, assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. We believe that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.
</DIV>
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	In our opinion, the consolidated financial statements referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of Profire Energy, Inc. as of March 31, 2016 and 2015, and the results of its operations and its cash flows for each of the years in the two-year period ended March 31, 2016, in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America.&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT">
	We also have audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), Profire Energy, Inc.&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting as of March 31, 2015, based on the criteria established in
<I>
	Internal Control&#8212;Integrated Framework (2013)
</I>
	issued by the Committee of&#160;Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO) and our report dated June 15, 2015,&#160;expressed an adverse opinion thereon.
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	/s/ Sadler, Gibb &amp; Associates, LLC
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	Salt Lake City, UT
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	June 13, 2016
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	43
</DIV>

<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage44"></A>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	PROFIRE ENERGY, INC. AND SUBSIDIARY
</DIV>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	March 31, 2016 and 2015
</DIV>
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	NOTE 1 &#8211; ORGANIZATION AND SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	This Organization and Summary of Significant Accounting Policies of Profire Energy, Inc. and Subsidiary ("the Company") is presented to assist in understanding the Company's financial statements. &#160;The Company's accounting policies conform to accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (US GAAP). On September 30, 2008, The Flooring Zone, Inc. ("the Parent") entered into an Acquisition Agreement with Profire Combustion, Inc. and the Shareholders of Profire Combustion, Inc. ("the Subsidiary"), subject to customary closing conditions. All conditions for closing were satisfied or waived and the transaction closed on October 9, 2008.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	Pursuant to the terms and conditions of the Acquisition Agreement, 35,000,000 shares of restricted common stock of the Company were issued to the three shareholders of Profire Combustion, Inc., in exchange for all of the issued and outstanding shares of the Subsidiary. As a result of the transaction, Profire Combustion, Inc. became a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Parent and the shareholders of the Subsidiary became the controlling shareholders of the Company. For accounting purposes, the Subsidiary is considered the accounting acquirer, and the historical Balance Sheets, Statements of Operations and Other Comprehensive Income, and Statement of Cash Flow of the Subsidiary are presented as those of the Company.&#160; The historical equity information is that of Profire Combustion, Inc., the accounting acquiree. The recapitalization required pursuant to this merger resulted in a negative additional paid-in capital balance.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<U>
	Organization and Line of Business
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	The Parent was incorporated on May 5, 2003 in the State of Nevada. The Subsidiary was incorporated on March 6, 2002 in the province of Alberta, Canada. &#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	The Company provides products and services for burners and heaters for the oil and gas extraction industry in the Canadian and US markets.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<U>
	Reclassification
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	Certain balances in previously issued financial statements have been reclassified to be consistent with the current period presentation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<U>
	Use of Estimates
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
	The preparation of financial statements in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and the reportable amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period. Actual results could differ from those estimates.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<U>
	Principles of Consolidation
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
	The consolidated financial statements include our wholly-owned subsidiary. Intercompany balances and transactions have been eliminated.
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">

<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<U>
	Foreign Currency and Comprehensive Income
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
	The functional currency of the Company and its subsidiaries in the U.S. and Canada are the U.S. Dollar ("USD") and the Canadian Dollar ("CAD"), respectively. The financial statements of the Company were translated to USD using year-end exchange rates for the balance sheet, and average exchange rates for the statements of operations.&#160; Equity transactions were translated using historical rates.&#160; The period-end exchange rates of 0.7711 and 0.7888 were used to convert the Company's March 31, 2016 and 2015 balance sheets, respectively, and the statements of operations used weighted average rates of 0.7642 and 0.8808 for the years ended March 31, 2016 and 2015, respectively. All amounts in the financial statements and footnotes are presumed to be stated in USD, unless otherwise identified. Foreign currency translation gains or losses as a result of fluctuations in the exchange rates are reflected in the Consolidated Statement of Income and Comprehensive Income (Loss), and the Consolidated Statements of Stockholders' Equity.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<U>
	Fair Value of Financial Instruments
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
	The fair value of a financial instrument is the amount that could be received upon the sale of an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date.&#160;Financial assets are marked to bid prices and financial liabilities are marked to offer prices.&#160;Fair value measurements do not include transaction costs.&#160;A fair value hierarchy is used to prioritize the quality and reliability of the information used to determine fair values.&#160;Categorization within the fair value hierarchy is based on the lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value measurement.&#160;The fair value hierarchy is defined into the following three categories:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Level 1: Quoted market prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Level 2: Observable market-based inputs or inputs that are corroborated by market data.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Level 3: Unobservable inputs that are not corroborated by market data.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	49
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #000000; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage50"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	PROFIRE ENERGY, INC. AND SUBSIDIARY
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	March 31, 2016 and 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	NOTE 1 &#8211; ORGANIZATION AND SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES (CONTINUED)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	Fair value estimates of financial instruments are made at a specific point in time, based on relevant information about financial markets and specific financial instruments. As these estimates are subjective in nature, involving uncertainties and matters of significant judgment, they cannot be determined with precision. &#160;Changes in assumptions can significantly affect estimated fair value.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	The carrying value of cash, accounts receivable, accounts payable and accrued liabilities approximate their fair value because of the short-term nature of these instruments. Management is of the opinion that the Company is not exposed to significant interest or credit risks arising from these financial instruments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<U>
	Cash and Cash Equivalents
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
	For purposes of the statement of cash flows, cash and cash equivalents include cash and all debt securities with an original maturity of 90 days or less. As of March 31, 2016 and 2015, cash and cash equivalents totaled $21,292,595 and $14,144,796 respectively. A small portion of these deposits were insured by the Company's banks and guaranteed by the FDIC and the CDIC.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<U>
	Accounts Receivable
</U>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
	Receivables from the sale of goods and services are stated at net realizable value. This value includes an appropriate allowance for estimated uncollectible accounts. &#160;The allowance is calculated based on past collectability and customer relationships. &#160;The Company recorded an allowance for doubtful accounts of $250,646 and $108,641 as of March 31, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="CLEAR: BOTH; LINE-HEIGHT: 12PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 12.55PT">
	The Company evaluates securities for other-than-temporary impairment at least on a yearly basis, and more frequently when economic or market conditions warrant such evaluation. Consideration is given to the length of time and amount of the loss relative to cost, the nature and financial condition of the issuer and the ability and intent of the Company to hold the investment for a time sufficient to allow any anticipated recovery in fair value. Pursuant to ASC 320-5, other than temporary impairment losses are recorded as impairment expense in the statement of operations during the period in which the impairment is determined.
</DIV>
